text: __NOTOC__ Tota was a Bishop of Selsey when Sussex was being ruled by Offa of Mercia. Not very much is known of Tota but he is recorded as present at a church council (Synod of Calcuthiens) attended by papal legates in 786.Heron- Allen Selsey Bill p. 120Kelly Charters of Selsey p. lxxxix He was consecrated between 781 and 786.Fryde, et al. Handbook of British Chronology p. 221 Tota died between 786 and 789. ==Notes== ==Citations== ==References== * * * ==External links== * Category:Bishops of Selsey Category:8th-century bishops
title: Tota (bishop)
